channel.title: Postgresql on Kev's Site
channel.description: Recent content in Postgresql on Kev's Site

item.title: Connect to PostgreSQL using an SSH tunnel
item.description: Using an SSH tunnel is a great way to administer remote services without having to directly expose them to the internet. You basically forward a port from your local machine (e.g. your Linux desktop) to a port on the remote server. You can then connect to the port on localhost and the magic of ssh will forward the port securely to the remote machine. To the remote server you’ve connected locally on localhost!
